trans-unit.source: Defines the metadata attribute of a Web content accessibility rule.
This class cannot be inherited.
An instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute> class defines a Web content accessibility rule that can be verified.
For more information on Web Content Accessibility Guidelines, see the [World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) Web site](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=37125).
The minimal amount of information required to define an instance of a <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute> includes:
A guideline that the verification rule represents.
The value specified in the constructor sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.Guideline%2A> property.
A checkpoint of the guideline.
The value specified in the constructor sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.Checkpoint%2A> property.
A checkpoint priority.
The value specified in the constructor sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.Priority%2A> property.
A <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationReportLevel> enumeration value that represents the reporting level that should be rule belongs to.
The value specified in the constructor sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.VerificationReportLevel%2A> property.
A message that is reported when the verification rule is true.
The value specified in the constructor sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.Message%2A> property.
Optional properties of the verification rule that can be specified when creating an instance:
A <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationRule> enumeration value that represents how the verification rule should be interpreted.
The value specified in the constructor sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.VerificationRule%2A> property.
A <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationConditionalOperator> enumeration value that represents the operator in the conditional expression used to test the verification rule.
The value specified in the constructor sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.VerificationConditionalOperator%2A> property.
An accessibility reference guideline URL.
The value specified in the constructor sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.GuidelineUrl%2A> property.
A conditional value representing the right side of a conditional expression.
The value specified in the constructor sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.ConditionalValue%2A> property.
A conditional property representing the left side of a conditional expression.
The value specified in the constructor sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.ConditionalProperty%2A> property.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute> metadata can be defined class, property, and indexer declarations.
For more information about using attributes, see [Attributes](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/30386922-1e00-4602-9ebf-526b271a8b87).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute"></xref> class with accessibility guideline, checkpoint, reporting level, checkpoint priority, and error message.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.%23ctor%2A> constructor of the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute> class specifies the minimal amount of information needed to define a verification rule.
The following default values for the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute> instance are assumed:
The <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.VerificationRule%2A> property is set as <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationRule.Required>.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.VerificationConditionalOperator%2A> property is set as <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationConditionalOperator.Equals>.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.GuidelineUrl%2A> property is set as an empty string ("").
The <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.ConditionalValue%2A> property is set as an empty string ("").
The <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.ConditionalProperty%2A> property is set as an empty string ("").

To specify values of the properties in the preceding list beyond their default values, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.%23ctor%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.%23ctor%2A> constructor overloads.
The accessibility guideline the verification rule describes.
The checkpoint within the guideline.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.VerificationReportLevel"></xref> values.
The priority of the checkpoint.
The message displayed when the verification rule is true.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute"></xref> class with accessibility guideline, checkpoint, reporting level, checkpoint priority, error message, <xref href="System.Web.UI.VerificationRule"></xref>.value, and related conditional property.
The `conditionalProperty` parameter is another property that is used as part of the conditional expression to evaluate the verification rule.
For example, if the rule parameter is <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationRule.NotEmptyString> then the related property specified by `conditionalProperty` must not be an empty string ("").
The following default values for the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute> instance are assumed:
The <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.VerificationConditionalOperator%2A> property is set as <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationConditionalOperator.Equals>.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.GuidelineUrl%2A> property is set as an empty string ("").
The <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.ConditionalProperty%2A> property is set as an empty string ("").
To specify values of the properties in the preceding list beyond their default values, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.%23ctor%2A> constructor overload.
The accessibility guideline the verification rule describes.
The checkpoint within the guideline.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.VerificationReportLevel"></xref> values.
The priority of the checkpoint.
The message displayed when the verification rule is true.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.VerificationRule"></xref>.values.
The left side of a conditional expression used to verify the accessibility rule.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute"></xref> class with accessibility guideline, checkpoint, reporting level, checkpoint priority, error message, <xref href="System.Web.UI.VerificationRule"></xref>.value, related conditional property, a related conditional property value, and a reference guideline URL.
This <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.%23ctor%2A> allows you to create an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute> class with all the possible properties specified.
The accessibility guideline the verification rule describes.
The checkpoint within the guideline.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.VerificationReportLevel"></xref> values.
The priority of the checkpoint.
The message displayed when the verification rule is true.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.VerificationRule"></xref>.values.
The left side of a conditional expression used to verify the accessibility rule.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.VerificationConditionalOperator"></xref> values.
The right hand side of a conditional expression used to verify the accessibility rule.
A reference URL for guideline.
Gets the accessibility checkpoint reference in the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.Guideline"></xref> property.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.Checkpoint%2A> property is set when the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute> instance is created and is required.

For the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines defined on the [World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) Web site](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=37125) the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.Checkpoint%2A> property is specified as a guideline number followed by a period (.) followed by a checkpoint number.
A string representing the checkpoint reference.
Gets the left side of a conditional expression used as part of the verification accessibility checkpoint.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.ConditionalProperty%2A> property can be set when the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute> instance is created, but is optional.
If you use a constructor that does not take a `conditionalProperty` parameter, the default value of an empty string ("") is used.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.ConditionalValue%2A> property is the right side, or value, of a conditional expression that is use in the verification of the accessibility checkpoint.
The left side of the conditional expression is specified with the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.ConditionalProperty%2A>.
The left side of the conditional expression.
The default value is an empty string ("").
Gets the right side of a conditional expression used as part of the verification accessibility checkpoint.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.ConditionalValue%2A> property can be set when the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute> instance is created, but is optional.
If you use a constructor that does not take a `conditionalValue` parameter, the default value of an empty string ("") is used.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.ConditionalValue%2A> property is the right side, or value, of a conditional expression that is use in the verification of the accessibility checkpoint.
The left side of the conditional expression is specified with the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.ConditionalProperty%2A>.
The right side of a conditional expression.
The default value is an empty string ("").
Gets the guideline that used for accessibility checking.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.Guideline%2A> property is set when the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute> instance is created and is required.
Examples of guidelines include "WCAG 1.1" and "ADA508".
A string representing the guideline.
Gets the URL the can be used to get more information on the accessibility guidelines given in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.Guideline"></xref> property.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.GuidelineUrl%2A> property can be set when the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute> instance is created, but is optional.
If you use a constructor that does not take a `guidelineUrl` parameter, the default value of an empty string ("") is used.
The string entered for the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.GuidelineUrl%2A> property is not checked for correctness.
The default value is an empty string ("").
Gets a message string when the accessibility checkpoint verification rule is true.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.Message%2A> property is set when the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute> instance is created and is required.
An error string.
Gets the priority of the accessibility checkpoint.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.Priority%2A> property defines the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.Checkpoint%2A> property's impact on accessibility.

Both the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.Checkpoint%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.Priority%2A> property are set when the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute> instance is created and is required.
An integer representing the priority.
Gets a <xref href="System.Web.UI.VerificationConditionalOperator"></xref> enumeration value indication how the accessibility checkpoint is verified.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.VerificationConditionalOperator%2A> property can be set when the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute> instance is created, but is optional.
If you use a constructor that does not take a `conditionalOperator` parameter, the default value of <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationConditionalOperator.Equals> is used.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.VerificationConditionalOperator"></xref> enumeration values.
The default value is <xref href="System.Web.UI.VerificationConditionalOperator.Equals"></xref>.
Gets a <xref href="System.Web.UI.VerificationReportLevel"></xref> enumeration value indicating how the accessibility checkpoint is used.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.VerificationReportLevel%2A> property is set when the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute> instance is created and is required.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.VerificationReportLevel"></xref> enumeration values.
Gets a <xref href="System.Web.UI.VerificationRule"></xref> enumeration value indicating how the accessibility checkpoint is used.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.VerificationRule%2A> property can be set when the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute> instance is created, but is optional.
If you use a constructor that does not take a `rule` parameter, the default value of <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationRule.Required> is used.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.VerificationRule"></xref> enumeration values.
The default value is <xref href="System.Web.UI.VerificationRule.Required"></xref>.
